description: Partly from Anglo-Norman repasser, partly from re- +‎ pass.

verbs.description: repass (third-person singular simple present repasses, present participle repassing, simple past and past participle repassed)

entries.meaning: To pass (back) again, especially in the opposite direction; to return.
examples: Isabell Queene of England, being to repasse from Zeland into her Kingdome with an armie, […] had utterly beene cast away, had she come unto the Port intended […].
